In Julia, Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Here is an example of how you can implement this in Julia using the Threads package:

```julia
using Threads

function pig_latinify(strings)
    results = zeros(Bool, length(strings))
    @threads for i in eachindex(strings)
        results[i] = pig_latin_transform(strings[i])
    end
    return results
end

function pig_latin_transform(str)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    new_words = map(words) do word
        if length(word) > 1
            word * "ay"
        else
            word * ""
        end
    end
    join(new_words, ' ')
end
```
This is a simple example and assumes that we are only dealing with words. If you want to handle punctuation or other special characters, this would need to be adjusted accordingly. The above function will return an array of booleans representing if each string was transformed successfully or not. This could happen for various reasons such as invalid input types, or the transformation itself failing due to some reason. You may want to handle these cases appropriately based on your needs.
